title: HTML Div & Span Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of HTML generic containers and semantic structure

questions.question: What is the main difference between <div> and <span>?
choices: <div> is for images, <span> is for videos
<div> makes text bold, <span> makes text italic
questions.explanation: <div> starts on a new line (block-level), <span> stays inline.

questions.question: Which tag would you use to highlight just one word in a paragraph?
questions.explanation: <span> wraps inline content without breaking the flow.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about <div>?
choices: It groups content but has no meaning by itself

questions.question: Why might <div> and <span> be considered "generic" containers?
choices: Because they can be used anywhere but don't add meaning
Because they are only for images
questions.explanation: They don't carry semantic meaning â€” just containers for structure or styling.

questions.question: Which is the best practice today?
choices: Use semantic tags when possible, and <div>/<span> when needed
questions.explanation: <div>/<span> are powerful, but semantic HTML improves accessibility and SEO.
